content.raw:
Smart pointers are definitely more convenient when it comes to memory management, but I also don't find this to be the primary argument against raw pointers. We have been managing memory effectively for decades, the problem with pointers usually arises around ownership of the pointer. Memory management and ownership are related, but they are not the same beast.

In this pull request, the ownership of the pointer is very clear. This is why I was arguing for raw pointers. However, the move mechanism in c++11 changed my mind.
